ygData.subject: RE: Flash of Light--a cleric's best offensive tool?
ygData.msgSnippet: Having used flash of light hundreds of times on myself...gotta do something while you are fishing ..grin If it works your screen freezes you cannot see what
ygData.messageBody:
Having used flash of light hundreds of times on myself...gotta do something
while you are fishing ..grin

If it works your screen freezes you cannot see what you are doing, your
mouse pointer freezes too. The area on the screen you see with (depending on
your viewing mode) goes black. However you can still use hotkeys but it
takes a clear mind to stay still (so not to interrupt your spell) and cast
cancel magic (or cure blindness) especially if someone is pounding on you.

I have only cast invulnerable once while being PK'd and it did not stop them
Pk'ing me. Never understood that. If someone has better exp in PvP, please
enlighten me.

If he understands invulnerable. He will see his spell has no effect and just
med for the 15 secs while you are invul.

Yes cancel magic can suck they way it works. Don't forget to buff against
poison as that is a big DOT for the Shaman.





-----Original Message-----
From: Kevin Dailey [mailto:kevin_dailey@...]
Sent: Friday, August 13, 1999 11:22 AM
To: 'EQ-Clerics@onelist.com'
Subject: [EQ-Clerics] Flash of Light--a cleric's best offensive tool?


From: Kevin Dailey <kevin_dailey@...>

"Flash of light is an awesome little tool, if it works. Its
fast and uses little mana. He also has cure blindness and he would be
stupid
to not have it memorized. If he is a lower level it can last a
reasonable
time."

I was told by a friend who hunted in Runnyeye that Verant issued a patch
that caused your ENTIRE screen to go black when you get blinded. I will
have to try this on myself. Because if this is the case, then even
though the troll shaman has me targeted, he will be unable to use his
mouse to click his memorized spells. He WILL be able to cast spells IF
he has hotkeyed them AND remembers which keyboard number goes to which
spell....but I know for a fact that this shaman hasn't done that.
So......It looks like I'm going to be a Flash of Light caster on Sunday
night at the PVP grounds in Neriak. Hmm....maybe I should first cast
Invulnerability on myself to get him to waste his mana, then blast him
with Flash of Light, and keep blasting him with it while I melee the
crap out of him.....means that I'm going to have to memorize extinguish
fatigue as well, cause it's gonna take me FOREVER to melee him to death.
And I should probably memorize Cancel magic in case he decides to root
me....But someone said earlier that Cancel magic starts at the top of
the stack. Why? That's where all MY buffs are! If I remember correctly
(from Highpass and the gnoll shamans who cast root), I think Cancel
magic starts at the bottom of the stack. Otherwise, it would be a
worthless friggin spell, eh?

Thanks for the suggestions so far...keep them coming...and let me know
what you think of the Flash of Light strategy :)

Saidinn
